steps.title: Cut the top end off of the papaya with a sharp knife.
steps.content: Cut the top end off of the papaya with a sharp knife. Papayas are very soft inside, so handle it gently. Use the sharpest knife you have, or a serrated bread knife, to get a clean cut. Start by cutting off the top end of the papaya.

steps.title: Slice the papaya in half lengthwise.
steps.content: Slice the papaya in half lengthwise. Make sure the flesh inside looks ripe and fresh. It should have a slightly funny smell.

steps.title: Scoop out the seeds from both halves of the papaya.
steps.content: Scoop out the seeds from both halves of the papaya. Use a spoon to remove the black seeds and the sticky membrane that coats them.

steps.title: Slice the papaya halves in half crosswise.
steps.content: Slice the papaya halves in half crosswise.

steps.title: Use a sawing motion to slice off the skin.
steps.content: Use a sawing motion to slice off the skin. Repeat with all four quarters.

steps.title: Slice the papaya into spears or chunks.
steps.content: Slice the papaya into spears or chunks. Eat them fresh and unadorned, or use them to make one of the recipes below.

steps.title: Prepare a papaya and other fruit.
steps.content: Prepare a papaya and other fruit. Wash a ripe papaya, slice it in half lengthwise, discard the seeds and slice off the skin. Cut the papaya into a few large pieces. A papaya smoothie is delicious on its own, but you can also choose to make it with other fruit. Consider these options: Fresh or frozen blueberries. Blueberries have a lot of antioxidants and paired with papaya they would make a powerfully healthy smoothie. Kiwi and avocado. The kiwi offsets the papaya's sweetness with its bright flavor, and avocado makes for an especially creamy smoothie. Spinach or kale. Making a "green" smoothie is a great way to get a serving of vegetables at breakfast. Papaya is so sweet and flavorful that you won't be able to taste the greens.

steps.title: Prepare the base.
steps.content: Prepare the base. Papayas taste good with both cream and juice bases. Try one of the following bases to thin out your smoothie: A cup of yogurt, either flavored or plain. A cup of almond or cashew milk. A cup of orange juice or apple juice.

steps.title: Add some extras.
steps.content: Add some extras. Enhance your smoothie with extra flavors or supplements to make it a complete meal. Consider the following options: A scoop of protein powder. A few spoonfuls of chia seeds. A tablespoon of peanut or almond butter.

steps.title: Blend the ingredients.
steps.content: Blend the ingredients. Place the fruit, base, and extras in a blender. Put the lid on the blender and use the "liquify" button to blend the ingredients until they are smooth. If you like a thinner smoothie, add more juice, milk or water. If you prefer your smoothies on the thicker side, add a few spoonfuls of instant oatmeal. Blend until smooth.

steps.title: Serve the smoothie.
steps.content: Serve the smoothie. Pour it into a glass and drink it with a straw, or if you made it extra thick, eat it with a spoon.
